page.title: 04SITTINGBOURNE TOWN CENTRE
page.content: As a result of our survey in the town centre we discovered that many people have lived in the area all their lives. A few moved here because of their work. Several frequently visit the town as it offers good shopping facilities. Most people use the larger shops. The smaller shops are finding it increasingly hard to compete and several have recently closed down. Many felt that more should be spent on leisure suggesting that a new sports centre with a swimming pool should be built. Others regretted the lack of a hospital and a few thought that there should be a greater variety of shops. People interviewed were unhappy with the road system and felt that pedestrianisation of the main street would be widely welcomed.
